text:
Hello everyone! my question is related to webhooks. Has anyone used them but the other way around. So the app that I’m using (in this case livestorm) is sending the webhook, but I don’t know how should I retrieve that information. Should I create a workflow as well on HubSpot or should I do it on the backend with a serverless function?

The theory of it seems more simple than doing requests but confusing to implement. Thanks in advance :rocket:
Hey guys , Is there any way to add new button on HubSpot for download invoice from another system ?

<@U03BA1PRV7S> Hello, did you deployed a similar project ?
Can you give me an example of your use, please.

Have a nice day

<@U03HVRC4LLD> I currently use a browser extension to add buttons to a contact record in HubSpot.
If you want to add a download button to the action row like my picture below, a extension is the only way. You definitely can accomplish a similar thing by using custom cards though <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards>

Hey Daniel, the connections tab currently isn’t developer extensible. It shows references between actions (outputs from previous actions or CRM properties that are used as inputs to the action, or outputs from the action that are used by other actions). Out of curiosity, is there something that you’re hoping to add to that tab?
